"}, {"content": "The Hindu one.

Explanation:

In Hinduism, there are two major religious groups: Hindus and Buddhists. Both groups have their own beliefs, practices, and traditions. Hindus worship many gods and goddesses, while Buddhists worship Buddha. 

Buddhists are perceived as annoying by some Hindus because they do not believe in the caste system and the idea of a Hindu god. Additionally, some Hindus may view Buddhism as a threat to their religion because it is seen as a competitor. 

In contrast, Hindus are perceived as different by some Buddhists because they have different beliefs and practices. For example, Buddhists may view Hinduism as a religion that is not monotheistic, while Hindus may view Buddhism as a religion that is not monotheistic. 

It is important to note that not all Hindus and Buddhists are religious, and there are many who do not practice their religion. Additionally, there are many who practice their religion in different ways, and it is not fair to make generalizations about any group.", "role": "assistant"}]
